padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/501028">lovetribe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-02-07">02/07/18 10:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>the review of blonc is perfect. a soap bar in a bottle. class in a bottle. 10/10 good performance.  perfect for a gentleman.  similar to fleur du male cologne.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4564"comment_id="909049"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Castile-4564.html?ccid=909049#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent907775" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc907775" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="blonc"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1008466"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1008466.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="blonc" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma907775ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd907775" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1008466">blonc</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-02-03">02/03/18 14:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Take a knife to the richest bar of soap you can find.  Slice off the thinnest shavings possible from that bar of soap, and then run your fingers through them.<br />
<br />
That's the smell of Castile when sprayed.<br />
<br />
It's easy to think that's all there is to it.  And, y'know what?  If that's all Castile was it would still be wonderful, because that soapy smell is so refreshing, so welcoming, and so perfectly clean.  You can wear it to work, wear it casually...  heck, you could even dress it up.  There's never a wrong time to smell clean.<br />
<br />
But if you're patient...  if you pay attention to how it smells a few hours later... you're in for a wonderful surprise.<br />
<br />
Lurking beneath that bright soapy freshness is a warm and soft but long lasting base which is wonderfully sensual.<br />
<br />
The opening of Castile smells inviting, but the base smells alluring.  It's like a secret that wants to be told.<br />
<br />
Castile has quickly become one of my all time favorites.  It's fantastic.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4564"comment_id="907775"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Castile-4564.html?ccid=907775#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent890424" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc890424" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gregk"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/860426"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="gregk" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma890424ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd890424" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/860426">gregk</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-12-15">12/15/17 09:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I find this quite similar to Colonia Essenza and Neroli Portofino Forte in a few ways. Bright and uplifting neroli, but with some of the herbal and green elements replaced with more of a 'classic' bar soap. I find most within this genre of soapy neroli scents comforting, and this one seems to last well enough, so I think it would be a great value if you're interested in either of the other two aforementioned scents</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4564"comment_id="890424"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Castile-4564.html?ccid=890424#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent867725" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc867725" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="andrew1983"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1089141"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1089141.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="andrew1983" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Endymion-5674.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5674.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Endymion"title="Endymion"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma867725ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd867725" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1089141">andrew1983</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-10-05">10/05/17 06:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This perfume is a neroli-bomb! Beautiful scent, but gave me a sense of nausea because of the very strong presence of neroli</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4564"comment_id="867725"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Castile-4564.html?ccid=867725#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent825155" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc825155" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="vinyl_junky"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1054736"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="vinyl_junky" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Geo-F-Trumper/GFT-5004.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5004.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="GFT"title="GFT"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma825155ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd825155" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1054736">vinyl_junky</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-05-22">05/22/17 22:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I think I found my new favourite Penhaligon's fragrance (which is tough, because I love most of them!). <br />
<br />
This is a lovely, clean, barbershop fragrance with a twist. The open is a crisp, citrusy bergamot with a hint of petitgrain. The neroli then kicks in, and sustains throughout the drydown. The neroli is definitely the star of the show here. <br />
<br />
It may not sound like the most original of compositions, but Penhaligon's has balanced the notes just right which makes this fragrance stand out. I would say this is unisex, and more of a daytime, fragrance for spring or summer. <br />
<br />
Surprisingly, I get very good longevity (for Penhaligon's) from this - around 6 hours, with moderate sillage.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4564"comment_id="825155"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Castile-4564.html?ccid=825155#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent821144" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; i absolutely love the classic soapy scent this has! there are some definite white florals breaking through the sudsy clean surface. it smells like extremely luxe soap from the Mediterranean!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4564"comment_id="821144"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Castile-4564.html?ccid=821144#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent804823" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc804823" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cellophane93"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1013274"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1013274.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cellophane93" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Byredo/Sunday-Cologne-13044.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.13044.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sunday Cologne"title="Sunday Cologne"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma804823ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd804823" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1013274">Cellophane93</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-03-22">03/22/17 13:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Starts quite sharp and almost caustic, like really, *really* clean sheets and washing detergent, but the dry down comes quickly and is a lovely white-grape-y-bubblegum Neroli that lasts for ages. This is one of those clean, soapy all-rounder scents, but an elegant one, like a slightly fresher, citrus version of Prada Amber pour Homme. Prada for the warmer months, if you will. Exactly what I was looking for.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4564"comment_id="804823"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Castile-4564.html?ccid=804823#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent801732" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc801732" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Leopold"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1053054"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1053054.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Leopold" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/James-Heeley/Cardinal-7844.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.7844.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cardinal"title="Cardinal"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma801732ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd801732" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1053054">Leopold</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-03-13">03/13/17 09:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very nice, clean and elegant offering, like most of Pehaligon's. Though some of them seem to me to be "just another good cologne" but with a different twist, this one has a very distinctive feel to it. Neroli, neroli, neroli. This one is definitely for neroli lovers. My partner wears it and I'm quite surprised by the longevity considering it's a "soft" scent. After an evening out I can still smell it in the car as we drive home. Gentle and beautiful.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4564"comment_id="801732"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Castile-4564.html?ccid=801732#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent792899" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1047200">Kuldeepsingh89</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-02-15">02/15/17 04:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very clean and fresh fragrence. Smells almost identical to acqua di parma colonia.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4564"comment_id="792899"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Castile-4564.html?ccid=792899#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent760713" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc760713" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PastelMoon"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/431468"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.431468.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="PastelMoon" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma760713ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd760713" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/431468">PastelMoon</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-11-13">11/13/16 00:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a great fresh scent. A lot like Mugler Cologne I love, which is not surprising as the main notes are the same between the two.<br />
<br />
Castille, however, starts much sharper, develops much stronger and its dry dow is slightly warmer that that of Mugler's.<br />
<br />
I sense it as a truly unisex and versatile scent, which can be adapt to most climates.<br />
<br />
Castille is clean, soapy and awakening. It feels elegant and far more noble that many other clean citrus scents, possesing a sparkly quality that remains well into lower stages, woody, musky and slightly metallic facets.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4564"comment_id="760713"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Castile-4564.html?ccid=760713#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent745153" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc745153" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LuxAestiva"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/984343"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.984343.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LuxAestiva" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ermenegildo-Zegna/Mediterranean-Neroli-34030.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.34030.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mediterranean Neroli"title="Mediterranean Neroli"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma745153ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd745153" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/984343">LuxAestiva</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-09-22">09/22/16 21:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really enjoy this at first. It's a fragrant viridescent mlange of citrus zest, neroli, musk, rose and soap. It's radiance and sharpness is really awakening and uplifting. A few hours in, perhaps 2 or so on my skin, the citrus burns off for the most part and you are left with the smell of average handsoap - not a luxury hand-milled olive Castile soap - but just any old liquid soap from a dispenser in a public restroom. I do like soapy notes, but I need a little more depth and balance. There is a sick tinge of sweetness to it that grosses me out. This was a blind buy for me and I'm still trying to decide how much I like it. Something does keep pulling me back to spray and I'm hoping I will start to understand it better and fall in love.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4564"comment_id="745153"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Castile-4564.html?ccid=745153#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent720848" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc720848" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="F2097"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1009212"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="F2097" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma720848ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd720848" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1009212">F2097</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-07-05">07/05/16 06:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is just really pleasant. It's a finely balanced slightly soapy, slightly peppery citrus. I really enjoy wearing it on a sunny day and find the longlivity good. <br />
<br />
Penhaligons have quite a lot of these type of slightly spiced citrus based fragrances (duo, no33, bayolea, quercus etc..). I like castile the best, probably in my top 3 for Penhaligons. I hear they used to make it a a soap too, would have loved to have tried it.<br />
<br />
It's not particularly original but there is a lot of balancing and finesse behind it that shines through and makes it worth the price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4564"comment_id="720848"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Castile-4564.html?ccid=720848#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent692694" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Compared to this they are lazy clean, this is soap with a bolt of electricity running through it. Effervescent and deep. Like an outdoor bath in a tangerine grove and it rains Tom ford neroli portofino but the sun is still dazzling</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4564"comment_id="692694"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Castile-4564.html?ccid=692694#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent655150" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc655150" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Errol the Flynn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/700054"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Errol the Flynn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Atkinsons/The-British-Bouquet-18972.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18972.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The British Bouquet"title="The British Bouquet"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma655150ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd655150" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/700054">Errol the Flynn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-12-08">12/08/15 15:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Castile is my fifth Penhaligon purchase. Already bought Blenheim Bouquet, elixir, english fern and Hamman. I have reviewed these on Fragrantica. <br />
<br />
I have to say that Castile is the most clean and soapy fragrance I have smelt  for some time. It has a classic fresh "just had a shave" scent which I find very uplifting. This is definitely a Sunday Morning Scent. I.e. Washed and shaved, slicked back hair, crisp white shirt and chinos sat in the local trendy coffee shop reading the Sunday papers. The fragrance is just so calming that it deserves those moments of quiet contemplation. The woman in your life will love this scent as it just projects a laundry clean smell that she will want to get close to and snuggle in there. I have english fern shaving soap and Castile EDT compliments this perfectly. A classic soapy barbershop fragrance  I highly recommend.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4564"comment_id="655150"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Castile-4564.html?ccid=655150#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent574875" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc574875" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="randy.devost1"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/164214"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.164214.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="randy.devost1" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma574875ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd574875" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/164214">randy.devost1</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-03-07">03/07/15 18:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If I had the ability to turn orange blossom water into an eau de parfum this would be it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4564"comment_id="574875"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Castile-4564.html?ccid=574875#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent434724" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc434724" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Houdini4"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/607493"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.607493.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Houdini4" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Les-Indemodables/Vanille-Havane-Coeur-de-Oud-96892.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.96892.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanille Havane Coeur de Oud"title="Vanille Havane Coeur de Oud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma434724ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd434724" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/607493">Houdini4</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-12-11">12/11/13 04:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wow for me this is a totally new take on orange blossom in that it doesn't start out with that waxy, over the top white floral, neroli thing to begin with. <br />
It's a dirty kind of citrus to begin with which has a vague Orange blossom underneath...and I honestly do detect rose and musk, it's a good opening which unfortunately doesn't last long.<br />
 About half an hour in... all that disappears! <br />
It becomes the familiar soapy white floral thing...incredibly soapy in fact!<br />
I don't particularly like this fragrance I just find it interesting how the opening notes mask the floral heart in the beginning.<br />
Not bad...a unisex fragrance with moderate longevity.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4564"comment_id="434724"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Castile-4564.html?ccid=434724#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent406350" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc406350" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LookOut"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/462911"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.462911.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LookOut" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Aqua-Allegoria-Orange-Soleia-58967.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.58967.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aqua Allegoria Orange Soleia"title="Aqua Allegoria Orange Soleia"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma406350ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd406350" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/462911">LookOut</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-09-14">09/14/13 09:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells very nice, very classy. But also (at least on my skin) very feminine. <br />
<br />
What I get out of this perfume is mostly the flowers. I usually dislike it when the rose stands out too much (like Penhaligon's Peoneve), but here the orange blossom balances it out nicely. Together with the bergamot it gets a fresh lemony (and kind of soapy) vibe.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4564"comment_id="406350"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Castile-4564.html?ccid=406350#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent399146" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc399146" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bluebellinthewoods"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/553278"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.553278.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="bluebellinthewoods" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Monotheme-Venezia/Vanilla-Blossom-10623.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10623.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanilla Blossom"title="Vanilla Blossom"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma399146ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd399146" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/553278">bluebellinthewoods</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-08-23">08/23/13 12:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Citrus blah but good quality citrus blah. Good longevity, classic but uninspiring.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4564"comment_id="399146"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Castile-4564.html?ccid=399146#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent394693" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc394693" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Redbeard"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/537021"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.537021.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Redbeard" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma394693ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd394693" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/537021">Redbeard</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-08-10">08/10/13 05:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I shouldn't really like this. It's a summery, soapy floral lemon to start with, like a mixture of Acqua di Parma and a good eau de cologne such as Extra Vieille. Maybe it's missing the rose in former, or the saltier herbs in the latter, but either way it just feels better balanced to me. Sniffing closer after a few minutes, it's a bit darker and greener with a wet, rich grassiness, but still somehow light and crisp; a combination seen in some of the better Gendarme scents such as Green. In the end, unfortunately, little is left beyond a well-groomed florid soap aura. Generally I'm very harsh in my judgments of Pen's scents because many have a common theme that seems too "perfumey" and feminine to me...Castile almost should as well, with such extensive floral notes, but I think it avoids that by its crispness, and ends up somehow unisex in a well-put-together way. Be prepared for the drop-off in strength later on, but I'd say that's forgiveable in this scent family.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4564"comment_id="394693"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Castile-4564.html?ccid=394693#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent379391" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc379391" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JoeMacchiato"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/441736"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.441736.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="JoeMacchiato" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Ylang-49-18383.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18383.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ylang 49"title="Ylang 49"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma379391ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd379391" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/441736">JoeMacchiato</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-06-21">06/21/13 18:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>SOAPY, in a good way. <br />
<br />
It lasts and lasts on my skin. Even after I shower, I can still smell the drydown on my skin. No jokes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4564"comment_id="379391"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Castile-4564.html?ccid=379391#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent336716" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc336716" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Francop"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/30064"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.30064.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Francop" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Andy-Warhol-Success-is-a-Job-in-New-York-6526.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6526.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Andy Warhol Success is a Job in New York"title="Andy Warhol Success is a Job in New York"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma336716ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd336716" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/30064">Francop</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-02-17">02/17/13 12:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This Penhaligon`s scent is an absolute sheer delight to wear.<br />
<br />
It starts fresh, crisp and citrusy until the neroli note arrives; this note plays the main theme of the scent for hours.<br />
<br />
Longevity on me is good; at least 5 hours with 3 sprays on my neck and chest.<br />
<br />
I choose to wear it on bright sunny winter days because of the uplifting effect it has on me. If the winter weather gets you down spray a bit of "Castile" on your neck and see what a big difference it makes on your mood and spirit.<br />
<br />
A Big winner from the House of Penhaligon`s.<br />
<br />
Big Thumbs up!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4564"comment_id="336716"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Castile-4564.html?ccid=336716#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent306345" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc306345" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Zenith"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/206253"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Zenith" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Salvador-Dali/Black-Sun-1112.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1112.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Black Sun"title="Black Sun"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma306345ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd306345" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/206253">Zenith</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-11-22">11/22/12 18:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A nice if dull tradition cologne.  While the notes seem well blended and suitable, this one just doesn't grab me.  <br />
<br />
Along with a lot of the other Penhaligon fragrances, this one also suffers form a lack of longevity, here and gone within a couple of hours.<br />
<br />
Nice pleasant and soapy, but don't expect a great deal from this one</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4564"comment_id="306345"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Castile-4564.html?ccid=306345#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent279784" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
